column4: i installed vnc4server via 'apt-get install vnc4server' on a dedicated server that i'm renting, but when i go to IP:1 in my vnc viewer it can't find the server
any used vnc4server before?
did it work for you?
yeah
i did
'vnc4server'
and it asked me for a password
no
Oh wait I understand.
I've done VNC before.
Did you launch the server by vncserver first off?
Hmm. And it doesn't show you any desktop?
It asked for a pw to set up the server...right.
Sorry I need some afternoon caffeine. Are you trying to use a NAT router? You might have to do some port forwarding.
Oh I see.
So we'll assume there is no NAT router. Now we gotta look at the way it connects.
I'll assume the address you gave earlier is the IP address. Let me see if I can connect.
Try using plain vncserver and closing down vnc4server and see if that makes a difference.
Hmm. There might be a firewall between you and the remote server. Check and remove them if necessary.
Hmm. There is something obvious I'm missing. I'm sorry.
Hmm. I'll google a little bit to see if there is anything obvious I'm missing.
Hmm no idea. Sorry.
